WGRZ 10:23 p.m. EDT October 4, 2015 Oct 4, 2015; Orchard Park, NY, USA; New York Giants quarterback Eli Manning (10) throws a pass under pressure by Buffalo Bills defensive tackle Kyle Williams (95) during the first quarter at Ralph Wilson Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Kevin Hoffman-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Kevin Hoffman, Kevin Hoffman-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ORCHARD PARK, NY â€“ The Bills' season so far has been a record of ups and downs. Week 4 was one of the downs. 
Rashad Jennings broke three tackles to score on a 51-yard touchdown catch midway through the fourth quarter in helping the New York Giants seal a 24-10 victory over the Bills. 
Eli Manning went 20 of 35 for 212 yards and three touchdowns in the win as the Giants improved to 2-2. The Giants limited Buffalo to a combined 77 yards and two first downs on its first nine possessions. 
The Bills, who were flagged 17 times for 135 yards, are also 2-2. 
Two On Your Side's Sports Director Adam Benigni and Sal Maiorana of the Democrat & Chronicle analyze what went wrong. Read or Share this story: http://on.wgrz.com/1LcEHUl More Stories
